intro: Diascia capensis, commonly known as the common diascia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its vibrant, tubular flowers that come in shades of red, pink, and purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers. Its ability to attract pollinators like bees and butterflies adds to its ecological value.
